reasoning: Hallux valgus (bunion) prevalence estimated at 2-4% of adult population, higher in females. Global prevalence approximately 3,000-4,000 per 100k adults. Incidence of surgical correction and newly diagnosed cases approximately 150 per 100k person-years. Data from podiatric surveys and orthopedic registries with moderate geographic variation.
source: Epidemiological surveys from orthopedic and podiatric literature
